item.title: There is a dead dog washed out on the beach next to Olympian Way walk, 22nd August
item.description:
I’ve noticed a dead dog washes out by the tide on the beach next to Olympian way. Could someone please collect it? It may have been a lost dog.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Manilla Walk, East Greenwich, London

item.title: Traffic Control Gate Open, 22nd August
item.description:
This was originally reported in May 2025 under reference number 7551441, which was subsequently closed without comment or action taken. Today, I have come close to being in a collision with a motor scooter whilst out walking my dog. The rider has entered the park area from the road and crossed the bridge into the adjoining road for whatever reason. This gate was obviously installed to prevent this type of thing happening but it is currently serving no purpose as it remains open and has been this way for some time. The RBG lists this as anti-social behaviour and states the following "It is illegal to ride a moped or motorbike in our parks. Using vehicles in parks can result in prosecution for dangerous driving offences and a £1,000 fine." Obviously, there is never anyone around with any authority when events like this take place but if the gate was functioning as it should be, then it would reduce or prevent this type of thing happening. Locking the gate may also help to reduce the dumping of rubbish in this particular spot, where almost weekly reports are raised for fly tipping. Once again, I request that you investigate this and restore the gate for the purpose it was intended. Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Roman Square, Thamesmead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unauthorized user of car park, 22nd August
item.description:
The car park for Stanton Court is being used by someone who is not a resident of the block. It is the neighbour opposite and it appears he has cut the adjoining wall and put a gate in so he can access the car park, and also use the grounds as a shortcut.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Amhurst Park, Hackney, London

item.title: The litter bins are still overflowing, 22nd August
item.description:
I have reported this twice now but it keeps be closed despite no resolution. Saying they will be done by the weekly cleanse is not working as it has been more than a week already. Please fix the problem before we end up with vermin along the pathway and surrounding areas.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blackwall Tunnel, Greenwich Peninsula, London
Report on FixMyStreet
